[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [SmallVec optimization] The SmallVec return type - can stack-allocated optimization lead to buffer overflows if multiple values are somehow returned instead of the expected single value? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Move bytecode validation] Does the bytecode verifier ensure borrow_address is only called on proper signer values from transaction senders, or can it be invoked on signers from other sources? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Reference counting] If SignerRef uses reference counting, can integer overflows in the ref count allow double-free or use-after-free when multiple borrow_address calls occur? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Memory leak] Can repeated calls to borrow_address without proper cleanup cause memory leaks in long-running transactions with many signer operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Dangling reference] After borrow_signer() returns a reference, can the underlying signer be moved or dropped, leaving callers with a dangling pointer to freed memory? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Stack overflow] Can deeply nested or recursive calls to borrow_address cause stack exhaustion, potentially crashing validator nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Transaction signer validation] Can borrow_address be called on signers from aborted or failed transactions, potentially leaking addresses from invalid transaction contexts? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Multi-sig transactions] In transactions with multiple signers, can borrow_address be exploited to access the wrong signer's address, breaking access control assumptions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Signer uniqueness] Can the same signer reference be borrowed multiple times in one transaction to create multiple address references, and could this violate Move's resource uniqueness guarantees? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Transaction replay] If a transaction is replayed with the same signer, does borrow_address return identical references, and could this enable replay attacks if reference identity is used for authentication? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Gas parameter manipulation] Can governance proposals maliciously set SIGNER_BORROW_ADDRESS_BASE to zero, allowing free signer operations and enabling spam attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Gas schedule updates] During epoch transitions when gas schedules change, can transactions in-flight use old or new gas prices inconsistently, causing state divergence between validators? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Integer overflow in gas] If SIGNER_BORROW_ADDRESS_BASE is set to an extremely large value, can gas calculation overflow and wrap to zero, bypassing gas charges? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: make_all()] [Native registration] Can the native function registration process be exploited to register multiple borrow_address implementations, creating ambiguity in which version gets called? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: make_all()] [Function name collision] Can other modules register natives with the name 'borrow_address', causing name collisions that route calls to malicious implementations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: make_all()] [Builder exploitation] Can vulnerabilities in SafeNativeBuilder.make_named_natives() be exploited to inject malicious native functions into the signer module? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: make_all()] [Iterator safety] The returned iterator - can consuming it multiple times or in the wrong order cause natives to be registered incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Module dependencies] Can changes to aptos_gas_schedule or aptos_native_interface break assumptions in this native, causing unexpected behavior without compile-time detection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [VM coupling] How tightly coupled is this implementation to move_vm_runtime internals? Could VM updates break the SignerRef implementation without this code being updated? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Type dependency] Changes to Type or Value enums in move_vm_types - can incompatible changes cause this native to misinterpret values passed to it? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Empty arguments] Even with debug assertions, what happens if arguments is empty in release mode when safely_pop_arg! is called? Does it panic or return an error? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Excessive arguments] If arguments contains more than 1 element, are the extras silently dropped, and could this hide bugs in calling code that passes incorrect argument counts? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Type argument injection] Even though _ty_args should be empty, what happens if non-empty type arguments are passed? Are they silently ignored, and could this mask bugs? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/signer.rs] [Function: native_borrow_address()] [Null context] Can SafeNativeContext ever be null or improperly initialized, and what happens if context.charge() is called on an invalid context? (High)
